instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Hello,


I got this logic board 820-2879. No signs of water damage. I get a green light. When shorting power pads I get a quarter fan spin and PPVCORE_S0_CPU pulses for a blink at about 0.9V.


PPBUS_G3H is 12.56V. What should I measure next?

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message: U7000, resistance on pins 17/18 and 27/28 is 4.5Ohm and 20.9Ohm respectively.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message: Any history to this thing? Without any this will be a time waster.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message: No water damage, but no history available... Should I ultrasonic it and give it another go before I throw it away?

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message: Yeah, there isn't much else you can do with these antiques.
